instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted on <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was shorted on <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> after water damage, i also repaired some broken traces next to SMC. but now I have an 0.02Amp consumption (what this problem called ?)
now i think the PCH is not turning on, what signals show up when the PCH is ok ?
<SIGNAL>PPVTRC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted on <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
PCH requires (4) RTC signals first; check RTC block on page 12.
Next, go to System Power Management block on page 13.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted on <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: SMC problem, replaced it working thanks
